reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Through different actions dealing with the Dniester's environment and basin management the Eco-Tiras involves national stakeholders to promote protection of environment sustainable development andpeace keeping in the region as well as do not allow their se lf-isolation from the pan-European andWorld environmental policy processes. The Dniester River is a unique subject which concentratesinterests of different population groups and permits to concentrate efforts of both conflicting sidesaround.Main feature of this project is that it is considered as a preparatory stage to coming into force the NewDniester River Basin Agreement. Thus active public involvement in this process is essential. Thespecial attention will be given to the ecological NGOs high school and university students schoolteachers and university lecturers academics local public authorities and politicians. All thesestakeholders will be informed and attracted to lobby progressive decisions and approaches to sharemodern knowledge on the river manage ment as well as to apply this knowledge in policy and decisionmaking. Because the trust-building needs more personal and individual approach it will be based onjoint actions implemented within the project (summer school for Youth, expeditions, Dniester Riv erBasin Conference, a study tour to Munich, jointly conducted assessment of climate change vulnerabilityof Dniester River basin).The project objectives are:- to strengthen the Dniester River basin stakeholders' community (mainly in frames of Moldovanborder s) in their knowledge skills and inter-linkages in the issues dealing with thetransboundary river and surrounding ecosystems' status the approaches to their management aswell as in raising of youth and general population awareness to prepare the public inv olvementin Dniester River Commission activities,-to build trust between the youth and intelligence groups of two Dniester banks at presentseparated by the frozen conflict,-to conduct an assessment of climate change vulnerability in the Moldavian part (MD + TR) of the Dniester River basin and elaboration of adaptation measures to prevent the furtherenvironment degrading worsening of population well-being and its impoverishment resulting inemigration.
